Description: Body sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed black with traces of two bands in added white; exterior: painted decoration consisting of lion (part of one foreleg remaining) to left; elaborate rosette as filling ornament; below, two dilute lines.
Curator's comments: The sherd likely represents part of an antithetical scene with two confronted lions separated by an elaborate rosette.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0902) (phase 2)
